title: cata-list
description: Lists of some of the best information, media, tools, and wisdom which can help to inform, empower, and act as catalysts for positive change in this perilous yet promising time.
copyright: Copyright © 2020 Matthew McCutcheon. All rights reserved

articles.title: Supreme Court Rules Georgia Can't Put the Law Behind a Paywall
articles.description: The state of Georgia licensed the official copy of state law to LexisNexis.

articles.title: Navy Releases Three Videos That Showcase 'Unidentified' Objects
articles.description: 'DOD is releasing the videos in order to clear up any misconceptions by the public.'

articles.title: 'Insect Apocalypse' More Complex Than Thought
articles.description: The health of insect populations globally is far more varied than previous research suggested.

articles.title: Insect Numbers Down 25% Since 1990, Global Study Finds
articles.description: Scientists say insects are vital and the losses worrying, with accelerating declines in Europe called 'shocking'

articles.title: Medical Staffing Companies Cut Doctors' Pay While Spending Millions on Political Ads
articles.description: While cutting benefits for emergency room doctors and other medical workers, TeamHealth and Envision have spent millions on ads meant to pressure politicians working on legislation to cap out-of-network costs for Americans.

articles.title: 'Heads We Win, Tails You Lose': How America's Rich Have Turned Pandemic Into Profit
articles.description: As 26 million Americans lose their jobs, the billionaire class has added $308bn to its wealth

articles.title: Drugmaker Jaguar Health Triples Price of Antidiarrheal Pill as It Pursues Coronavirus Use
articles.description: Jaguar Health is in financial trouble and turned to a massive price hike.

articles.title: Many Supposedly Grassroots Reopen Sites Are Tied to One Pro-Gun Lobbyist
articles.description: Sites protesting the COVID-19 lockdown are an astroturf campaign, researchers say.

articles.title: Over 100 Militant Groups Have Been Promoting Second Civil War on Facebook
articles.description: God help us if Mark Zuckerberg's next congressional hearing is on the subject of the Bloody Insurrection of 2020. As HuffPost first reported, a scourge of far-right extremist accounts on Facebook appear to be gearing up for a meme-inspired civil war amid the covid-19 outbreak.

articles.title: Coronavirus Death Toll Has Now Surpassed 50,000 in the U.S.
articles.description: The number of deaths being attributed to the novel coronavirus has now exceeded 50,000, according to data maintained by Johns Hopkins University.

articles.title: Trump Corrects Conservatives: I Did Suggest Injecting Disinfectant but Only as a Hilarious Joke
articles.description: Conservatives would have you believe that the president didn't suggest injecting disinfectant as a potential coronavirus cure on Thursday. But Trump himself now says he did—apparently 'sarcastically' as part of a private, convoluted prank.

articles.title: 'Murder Threats' to Telecoms Engineers Over 5G
articles.description: Key workers reveal the abuse they've received while working on the UK's communications networks.

articles.title: In Four U.S. State Prisons, Nearly 3,300 Inmates Test Positive for Coronavirus -- 96% Without Symptoms
articles.description: When the first cases of the new coronavirus surfaced in Ohio's prisons, the director in charge felt like she was fighting a ghost.

articles.title: US Blames China for Hacks Allegedly Targeting COVID-19 Research
articles.description: US officials are pinning a surge of hacks on a Chinese bid to steal COVID-19 treatment and vaccine research.

articles.title: US Was Warned of Threat From Anti-Vaxxers in Event of Pandemic
articles.description: FBI-connected researchers suggested biggest threat in controlling outbreak was from 'those who categorically reject vaccination'

articles.title: Chinese Trolls Are Spreading Coronavirus Disinformation in Taiwan
articles.description: 'Even in five years of looking at troubling disinfo every day, I'm not sure I've ever seen anything quite this malicious.'

articles.title: U.S. Economy Shrinks at 4.8% Pace, Signaling Start of Recession
articles.description: The record-long U.S. economic expansion is over after almost 11 years, with what’s likely to be the deepest recession in at least eight decades now under way.

articles.title: Nine Million Logs of Brits' Road Journeys Spill Onto the Internet From Password-Less Number-Plate Camera Dashboard
articles.description: Democratising mass surveillance, one snafu at a time

articles.title: How Spies Snuck Malware Into the Google Play Store — Again and Again
articles.description: Malicious Android apps from the so-called PhantomLance campaign targeted hundreds of users, and at least two slipped past Google's defenses.

articles.title: Pence Comes Under Fire for Going Maskless at Mayo Clinic
articles.description: MINNEAPOLIS (AP) — Vice President Mike Pence chose not to wear a face mask Tuesday during a tour of the Mayo Clinic in Rochester, Minnesota, an apparent violation of the world-renowned medical...

articles.title: Trump Admin Threatens to Sue States That Don't Lift Pandemic Orders
articles.description: AG Barr says state orders for containing COVID-19 may violate Constitution.

articles.title: More Than 1 Million People in the US Have Tested Positive for COVID-19
articles.description: The most of any country in the world.

articles.title: Toxic PFAS Fallout Found Near Incinerator in Upstate New York
articles.description: PFAS contamination was found in soil and water near an incinerator in New York state that has been burning firefighting foam for the Department of Defense.

articles.title: Chinese Internet Users Who Uploaded Coronavirus Memories to GitHub Have Been Arrested
articles.description: Some people had been using GitHub, which remains accessible in China, to preserve articles and accounts of the pandemic before they get scrubbed by censors.

articles.title: Overseas Censorship of Chinese Issues
articles.wikiextract: Overseas censorship of Chinese issues refers to censorship outside the People's Republic of China of topics considered sensitive by the ruling Communist Party of China. Censored topics include the political status of Taiwan, human rights in Tibet, Xinjiang re-education camps and the persecution of Uyghurs, the Tiananmen Square Massacre, the 2019–20 Hong Kong protests, and human rights in China in general. With limited pushback by foreign governments and corporations, these issues have led to growing concern about self-censorship, compelled speech and a chilling effect on free speech in other countries.

articles.title: Self-Censorship
articles.wikiextract: Self-censorship is the act of censoring or classifying one's own discourse. This is done out of fear of, or deference to, the sensibilities or preferences (actual or perceived) of others and without overt pressure from any specific party or institution of authority.

articles.title: Compelled Speech
articles.wikiextract: Compelled speech is a transmission of expression required by law. A related legal concept is protected speech.  Just as freedom of speech protects free expression, in many cases it similarly protects an individual from being required to utter or otherwise express a thought with which they disagree.

articles.title: Chilling Effect
articles.wikiextract: In a legal context, a chilling effect is the inhibition or discouragement of the legitimate exercise of natural and legal rights by the threat of legal sanction. The right that is most often described as being suppressed by a chilling effect is the US constitutional right to free speech. A chilling effect may be caused by legal actions such as the passing of a law, the decision of a court, or the threat of a lawsuit; any legal action that would cause people to hesitate to exercise a legitimate right (freedom of speech or otherwise) for fear of legal repercussions.
